info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 4:31PM EDT until July 30 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 431 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Monroe, or near Unionville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Unionville, Wingate, Marshville, Fairview In Union County, Sturdivants, New Salem, Hemby Bridge, Stallings and Indian Trail. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
